label: Description
value: The stern of a sail ship with the Napoleonic eagle as a mast head, a trident, an oar are shown in the top part, an axe, a sword, an anchor, a laurel wreath and a compass suspended from a scarf, in the bottom part. Laurel boughs form the background. Colored ground.

label: Physical description
value: Pencil, pen, and ink with Chinese black ink on paper, pricked

label: Provenance
value: Eugène Rodrigues (Lugt 897); Jean Léon Decloux; 1908; Acquired by Museum from the Advisory Council

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Candelabrum with two lateral framing growths.  The central stem consists of a calyx section, a base with crouching lions flanking an ovoidal medallion, an urn, a thyrsus.  Framing strip.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash, pencil on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Gaine with the bust of Dionysus supporting a bowl full of bunches of grapes and leaves from which a faun with a thyrsus and two acanthus scrolls rise.  A disk with roses and a trophy are suspended from the scroll at right.  A flower basket standing upon the head of the half-figure of a lion, below.  The left half shows the half-figure of a lion supporting a flower basket over which a thyrsus rises and to which a trophy of pastoral musical instruments is fastened.  Framing strip.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Fountain consisting of a pedestal of two dolphins and a mask which support the basin in which water flows.  A shell rises from behind the basin obliquely to the entablature of the niche forming an opening in the wall at the top.

label: Physical description
value: Red chalk on off-white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Ceiling with Alternative Suggestions

label: Description
value: Shown is a central medallion with three radiating quadrangles. The medallion shows a framed tent motif. The left quadrangle shows two nudes seated on a pointed arch. Medallion above. Center quadrangle shows two entwined boughs and a ribbon hung with a mask, flute and ewer. The right quadrangle shows a tablet with a centaur surrounded by grotesques. Medallion above.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Two out of eight sides are shown form the inside.  Supported by poles, of which the top of one is shown.  Their capitals are connected by a frieze with a crest border from which lambrequins are suspended.  The left one of the upper triangles shows a girl carrying a flower basket upon a pedestal.  A candelabrum decorates the right one, including swans, a peacock, and other birds, and a putto holding a garland.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and gouache water color, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Wrought Iron Balcony

label: Description
value: Central section: an escutcheon is flanked by scrolls. left section suggests a triangular form over a shield form, the triangle intended to have a symmetrical counterpart in the right section. Right section: Shield form, upon a base. Scales at the bottom and at right. Includes alternative suggestions for the lateral sections.

label: Physical description
value: Pencil, pen, ink, brush, and Chinese black on paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux; 1908; Acquired by Museum from the Advisory Council

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Simply delineated window case and frame for tall casement windows.  Window treatment consists of blue fabric dotted with pink spots, gathered in center and corners to create short festoon and pleats on either side.  This valence lays over a pale pink curtain, also gathered just above the center of the window frame on either side, yielding a soft drape and pleats.  Both curtains and valence are ornamented with yellow fringe having darked eneds.  Tiebacks match fringe.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on off-white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Elevation of a wall of a vestibule

label: Description
value: A central arch flanked by engaged, fluted Ionic columns and two wall panels. Inside the arch stands the figure of a woman on a pedestal. She supports a fruit bowl with candles on her head and hands. The height of the wall is given as "16 pied 50."

label: Physical description
value: Pen and Chinese ink, brush and light brown watercolor wash, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for the Elevation of the Entrance Wall of a Salon

label: Description
value: A wall panel with a looking glass is flanked by panels with panoplies and folding doors. Another wall panel is beside the right door. It is decorated with an arabesque, in which doves are billing before the foot of a burning lamp.

label: Physical description
value: Pen, brush, Chinese black, and light blue and yellow watercolor washes on paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux; 1908; Acquired by Museum from the Advisory Council

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Trophy consisting of a ewer encircled by a wreath of flowers, a walking staff angled at center, olive branches above and below, all bound by a ribbon tied in a bow.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and rose, brown watercolor, wash, on cream laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Elevation of the Entrance Wall of a Hall

label: Description
value: Five fluted pilasters frame wall panels in which three folding doors alternate with two simulated arched window openings. Cast shadow in the top part. Bottom margin: the scale.

label: Physical description
value: Pen, Chinese ink, rose watercolor and ink washes on paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux; 1908; Acquired by Museum from the Advisory Council

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Design for a panel with semi-circular ends, top, and bottom. A trophy of pastoral objects and a flower basket are suspended from a bracket. A circular medallion is in the center, showing Cupid having shot an arrow and standing on clouds. The doves of Venus are beside him at left. Tops of trees in the right distance. Framing line and striped. Verso: green crayon scribbling and scrolls.

label: Physical description
value: Pen, ink with water color on paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux; 1908; Acquired by Museum from the Advisory Council

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A vase shape with two handles standing on a pedestal.  Two of the three intended arms are shown emerging from the vase.  Ram's heads are applied near their upper ends from which festoons hand toward spirals.  A pole which is decorated with flowers rises on top  Framing lines.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash, on paper.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A vase shape stand upon a richly decorated baluster which rises from a base which is intended to be supported be four lion's feet.  From a calyx on top of the case emerge two acanthus scrolls carrying the sockets with low burning candles and a thyrsus.  Framing pencil lines.  Margin.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: From a vase standing on top of a shaft emerge two acanthus rinceaux holding sockets with low burning candles and a caduceus. Framing lines. Margins.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink with ink washes on paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux; 1908; Acquired by Museum from the Advisory Council

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Two busts of Egyptian women serve as handles of a case from which three twisted cords emerge. Two are curved laterally and hold acanthus spirals which support two sockets. The central one rises straight and carries a socket. The sockets are split at the top edges; fires rise from them. Pearl chains connect the vegetable motifs. Framing lines. Margins.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash, on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A vase shaped stand upon a shaft to which lion chimaerae are fastened.  From a calyx on the top case rise two ivy stems carrying sockets with low burning candles and a socket shaped like a trumpet and carrying a fire.  Framing lines and margin.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Design for a candelabrum with a vase-shaped base with Satyr faces on the sides and acanthus scrolls as handles. Three branches in the shape of plant boughs with leaves, each carrying a blossom intended as a socket on top.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: The scheme of the design is a variation of that of -149. The plant shows acanthus and naturalistic motifs. The vase has angular handles. The decoration stresses the horizontal dimensions.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Wainscotted Wall Panel

label: Description
value: The projecting central section shows probably a frame of mirror over a moulding. Pilaster strips with circular medallions showing children, laterally. Dad underneath. Outside are parts of door openings with overdoor. Section of the mouldings. Bordering ink lines.

label: Physical description
value: Pencil and ink with ink washes on paper

label: Description
value: Circular base, of ogee profile, decorated with beading and acanthus. Shaft formed by three terms, addorsed. Socket a Krater with three lion-mask handles and large brim.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Chamber candlestick with stepped base, scalloped at bottom. Two s-curve branches support ringed sockets. Finial at center. Ring handle with thumb rest. Candle snuffer is a small hollow cone with ball finial. Undecorated snuffer used to extinguish the flame and trim the wick of a candle.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Heavily moulded, resting on four feet decorated with women's busts. Double cover hinged through shorter dimension, with cylindrical grater in center.

value: Bowl with ornamental scroll handles. Cover has three medallions inscribed.

value: Shaped sides, oval, on four short legs; hinged and pierced lid with grid on top; scrolled brass hinged handle with wooden crosspiece. Separate copper liner with two small ring handles.

value: Dish is a decagon in plan, rounded with gadrooning at bottom. Pierced throughout. Three shell-shaped prongs connecting to shell-shaped feet. Turned wood handle.

value: On three feet, which extend above brim of circular basin. Gadrooned design in repoussé in bottom of basin. Handle turned.

label: Description
value: Bag of beaded knitting with leather lining. Beads worked in triangular patterns at bottom; main field has floral garlands encircling the bag with inscription: Johann Tobias Marzius 1821.

value: Light brown bag encircled by a white band with a floral vine in blues and greens, with guard bands of white stylized vines.
